bean.name: DefaultHeaderFilterStrategy
bean.title: Default Header Filter Strategy
bean.description: The default header filtering strategy. Users can configure which headers is allowed or denied.

inFilter.description: Sets the in direction filter set. The in direction is referred to copying headers from an external message to a Camel message. Multiple patterns can be separated by comma

outFilter.description: Sets the out direction filter set. The out direction is referred to copying headers from a Camel message to an external message. Multiple patterns can be separated by comma

lowerCase.label: advanced
lowerCase.description: Whether header names should be converted to lower case before checking it with the filter Set. It does not affect filtering using regular expression pattern.

allowNullValues.label: advanced
allowNullValues.description: Whether to allow null values. By default a header is skipped if its value is null. Setting this to true will preserve the header.

caseInsensitive.label: advanced
caseInsensitive.description: Sets the caseInsensitive property which is a boolean to determine whether header names should be case insensitive when checking it with the filter set. It does not affect filtering using regular expression pattern.

filterOnMatch.label: advanced
filterOnMatch.description: Sets what to do when a pattern or filter set is matched. When set to true, a match will filter out the header. This is the default value for backwards compatibility. When set to false, the pattern or filter will indicate that the header must be kept; anything not matched will be filtered (skipped).
